Package ca.uwaterloo.crysp.otr.crypt

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Cipher
    Interface for encrypting/decrypting messages.
    DHPrivateKey
    Interface to a Diffie-Hellman private key.
    DHPublicKey
    Interface to a Diffie-Hellman public key.
    DSAPrivateKey
    Interface to a DSA Private (Signing) Key.
    DSAPublicKey
    Interface to a DSA Public (Verification) Key.
    Hash
    Interface for generating and verifying the hash digest of a message.
    Key
    Top-level interface for all keys.
    KeyAgreement
    The interface that allows 2 parties to generate a shared secret by exchanging their public keys with each other.
    KeyGenerator
    Class that generates secret key.
    KeyPairGenerator
    Class that generates pairs of public and private keys for various asymmetric algorithms.
    MAC
    Interface for signing and verifying data.
    PrivateKey
    Empty interface for a private key.
    PublicKey
    Empty interface for a public key.
    SecretKey
    Empty interface for a secret key used in symmetric algorithms.
    SecureRandom  
    Signature
    Interface for signing and verifying data.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractCipher
    Abstract cipher class.
    AbstractMAC
    Abstract MAC class that provides the generic calls to tag() and verify() when the optional parameters are not specified.
    AbstractSignature
    Abstract signature class that provides the generic calls to sign() and verify() when the optional parameters are not specified.
    AESCTR
    Abstract class for AES in counter mode.
    AESKey
    Interface for an AES Key.
    DHKey
    Abstract class for a Diffie-Hellman Key.
    DHKeyAgreement
    Abstract implementation of the Diffie-Hellman key exchange.
    DHKeyPairGenerator
    Abstract Diffie-Hellman keypair generator.
    DHSesskeys  
    DSAKey
    Abstract class for a DSA signing (private) or verification (public) key.
    DSAKeyPairGenerator
    Generates KeyPairs containing signing and verification keys for DSA Signatures.
    HMAC
    The HMAC digital signature algorithm.
    HMACKey
    Abstract class for a HMAC key.
    HMACKeyGenerator
    Generates Key for HMAC.
    KeyPair
    A KeyPair is a public/private key pair for a digital signature system.
    MPI  
    Provider
    A class representing a crypto provider (for example, JCA or RIM).
    RawDSA
    The DSA digital signature algorithm, without doing extra hashing.
    SHA1
    The SHA-1 hash algorithm.
    SHA256
    The SHA-256 hash algorithm.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    OTRCryptException
    Exception class for possible exceptions that are thrown by crypto functions.
